Question: This person, a moderate from a swing state, secured the Republican Party presidential nomination in 1860.
Hints: In 1863, this person declared the final Thursday in November of that year to be a day of Thanksgiving.
President Buchanan and President-elect this person refused to recognize the Confederacy, declaring secession illegal.
Meanwhile, this person and nearly every Republican leader agreed that the dismantling of the Union could not be tolerated.
